text: Kindazi (, dkinda2-zi) was a minor Sumerian god. He was a "divine barber" and an acolyte of god Ningirsu. He is known from inscriptions, such as a macehead dedicated by queen Ninkagina for the life of King Nam-mahani of Lagash: He also appears in various other inscriptions, such as the Gudea cylinders. ==References== Category:Mesopotamian deities
title: Kindazi
